title: Pacific Collegiate Hockey Association
section_text: When the PCHA was split into two divisions the Division 1 champion was awarded the Adams Cup named after founder Cary Adams . The Division 2 champion was awarded the Warden Cup named after former president Doc Warden . In the modern era , the PCHA champion was awarded the Adams Cup . intro: The Pacific Collegiate Hockey Association (PCHA) is a collegiate hockey conference within Division 2 of the ACHA. The PCHA has been in operation for more than 40 years and administers the PCHA Playoffs at the conclusion of each regular season. The winner of the PCHA Playoffs receives the coveted Adams Cup, named after Cary Adams who started the conference.
